seo.title_override: Philly Mattress Disposal Guide 2026: Rules & Tips
seo.meta_desc_override: Avoid Philadelphia's $300-$1,000 mattress disposal fines! Learn the rules for proper disposal, including curbside pickup options, to keep your Philly streets clean.

hero_hook: Navigating Philadelphia's mattress disposal rules can be tricky, especially with fines and rainy weather looming.
neighborhoods: Fishtown, Northern Liberties, Rittenhouse Square, Old City, Manayunk, Chestnut Hill, Graduate Hospital, Point Breeze, Queen Village, East Passyunk Crossing, University City, Kensington, Brewerytown, Fairmount, Bella Vista

curbside_rules.placement_time: Place items at your normal collection point (curbside or rear driveway) the evening before your pickup date (no earlier than 5:00 p.m. during Fall and Winter and 7:00 p.m. in Spring and Summer). Ensure items are curbside by 7:00 a.m. on pickup day.
curbside_rules.size_limits: Philadelphia residents can schedule bulk item pickups for up to four (4) items per appointment. Passenger car tires (rims removed; 4 tires = 1 bulk item). The Department of Sanitation will continue to collect up to two (2) large items (non-metal) per household on regularly scheduled trash collection days.
curbside_rules.the_catch: Larger apartment buildings, condominiums, and commercial properties are not eligible for the program and must use private haulers. The city will not enter homes to collect items. Residents are responsible for ensuring items are placed in accessible locations on time. The city is not liable for items taken before pickup. Sanitation will not collect items that are not included in the Bulk Collection program, such as household trash and mattresses (wrapped in plastic), hazardous, flammable, or explosive materials, auto parts, and construction or demolition debris.
curbside_rules.schedule_logic: Residents can schedule appointments through the Department of Sanitation’s website or by contacting 311. Appointments are limited and will be scheduled on a first-come, first-serve basis. After scheduling, you’ll receive an email with: Pickup Code: Mark items for pick-up with this 4-letter code. Service Request Number: Use this for any follo

weather_profile.rejection_risk_copy: WARNING: Philadelphia averages 100+ rainy days per year. If your mattress gets wet before pickup, the city WILL NOT take it (too heavy, mold risk). Our haulers pick up from inside your home — rain or shine.
